text: Is there a good way to reverse the interpolation, like I have y = interp(x), but I want x = interp(y), and a say i have f(x)^2, I'll have repeat values so I want it to spit out at all points

elements.text: Is there a good way to reverse the interpolation, like I have y = interp(x), but I want x = interp(y), and a say i have f(x)^2, I'll have repeat values so I want it to spit out at all points

text: You could by splitting x into intervals where x -> y is monotonous

elements.text: You could by splitting x into intervals where x -> y is monotonous

text: so like from -1 to 0 and then 0 to -1?
